Reviews.Title: “Ask first if the room has a window or not!”
Reviews.Author: JohnDoe049
Reviews.Content: I had to make a last minute reservation for Singapore and this was one of the convenient hotels considering the prices and location. However, the room was tiny, didn't have a window, and as it was a smoking room had a heavy smell of smoke (I don't smoke by the way). Although I have read some bad comments about the hotel before and somehow tried to prepare myself for it, my 2 nights there were terrible, and if you didn't stay before at a windowless room I don't recommend it at all. Even if you want to save money, stay at a lower quality hotel but not at a windowless one, after some time you feel suicidal. Apart from it, the location of the hotel is very close to the subway station (5 minute walk) and don't feel intimidated by the location of it because Chinatown is beautiful. Although I have before read some comments on it, the hotel staff was very helpful and I didn't experience any bad attitude. Overall, it was a poor, if not terrible, experience for me, but if you can have a room with a window, yours can be just better.

Reviews.Title: “Enter your own risk!!”
Reviews.Author: YennyW76
Reviews.Content: The good thing about this hotel only its free wifi with very high speed quality, the cold AC and the location. Price too high for the room. The room is so small and smoking-smell. Not very clean. The bathroom is so small. I don't think I will be back there. :(

Reviews.Title: “Fun Location--basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lack of screen name
Reviews.Content: The Hotel 81 Chain provides reasonable prices for a budget hotel in Sinagpore, a very expensive town. the one in Chinatown is a little more expesive, but still a reasonable price inSingapore for a clean safe hotel. The location in Chinatown is fun. You can walk the streets very easily. the room itself is tiny, and the shower is not separate--just part of the bathroom. If you plan on spending a lot of time in the hotel, then look for a bigger room. if you plan on sleeping there and checking emails, it is fine (though there is not much room for bags.)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, OK price”
Reviews.Author: joannadan01
Reviews.Content: Chose the hotel because of the location and the fact this is one of the few hotels in Chinatown within price range that has elevators and windows. Matched expectation although the toilet/shower can be a bit cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever enter Hotel 81!!!”
Reviews.Author: gennie86
Reviews.Content: First day we arrive at Singapore, at first we are not staying to this hotel.We are heading to our booking in "Diamond Residency" Chinatown. When we arrive and we found out the Hostel is bankrupt and we still found a man in that hostel but he told us that the people manage this hostel is runaway. We are worried because its Christmas period and immediately found a hotel and we saw Hotel81 just in front Chinatown MRT.The hotel rate is day by day increase due to nearer to Christmas and we had no choice to paid 3 nite to stay there due to last minute.Beside , they need us paid for 3 nights fees in full without print receipt to us and that time i said must need a receipt from them since its paid. Although it's out of our budget but is not a main problem , but there service is very bad!! First night , we had assign to the next door of the lift and beside our room that is a fire alarm system , every 5 sec will "Beep" 1time. It was irratating , the whole we can't sleep. The next day we decide to change room and suddenly they restrict us cannot 4 people in a room. But when we had made our payment , there is no any restriction on headcount. But the staff no immediately take any action , then we just put our luggage on lobby. The same night , we back hotel around 12am and one of the staff mentioned we cant 4 ppl in a room. She keep called our room line ... ringing 5 minutes keep disturb us and ask our freind immediately left the hotel said their hotel rules just give friend come 10 minutes. If not should check in another room.The room is not cheap SGD220 ++ per nite! Somemore is late night force us to check in another room. The staff keep knocking our door and argue with us. She mentioned if tonight we will not check in another room , then she will forfeited our 3rd nite accomodation fees!!!We had mentioned to them , if they dare to forfeited and at first never said we cant 4 ppls in a room then we will report police.Beside , her attitude is forcing us and talk to us really no manners at all.Somemore we got the receipt of paying 3 nights accomodation. Its totally a scam , becareful of this hotel!! The next day , my other 2 fren is forcing to find another hotel to stay and almost other hotel is fully booking. That last day , just we 2 person in a room. Can you imagine when 12pm , they really want us to check out. The Staff is knocked 1 time and straight away use key to open our door and ask us to leave. Can you imagine open your door without any informing... Frighten us!!! The staff at last request my another friend passport to register again and at last they let us to stay for last night! How is their service !!! We are their customers ... how can we been treaten like that , is that we are foreigner?Singaporean is looked down Malaysian? The last night we back around 1am+ .. the lady keep irratating to call us to lobby because need to show the key to them to see then we can go up. Are we going to jail? Can you imagine staying in HOTEL81 for 3 nite.First nite the fire alarm beep every 5 dec , put us to the next door of the fire alarm. Once we swich put us to the near roadside room. Second night 12am+ , called our room phone and knocked our door , either force my friend left the hotel now or check in another room. Is Late Night!!! The last day , open our room without informed , use their key to open although we are still inside and mentioned our room is been forfeited!!!! Every day also had thing happen , do you dare to go in this hotel again. Bad impression to Singapore and this is my first trip!

Reviews.Title: “It is ok for couple of days”
Reviews.Author: pelen23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in 10 min walking distance to the financial distict so i can easily say it is in a good location.however, the room is really small ( stayed in a double-bed room),bathroom (well i should call it toilet with shower) was also very small. During checking in they asked us if we wanted to stay a room with window and warned us if we chose one with window , it might be noisy. We were really tired so it didnt bother us at all. it was clean and we had everything we needed such as a kettle, hair dryer ect. it is an ok place if you are visiting Singapore for couple of days

Reviews.Title: “Handy location”
Reviews.Author: AlternativesGalore
Reviews.Content: Have spent several times at the various Hotel 81 locations. Their China town location is very handy to China town (a must for new visitors) and is close to the MRT which will bring your anywhere in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: apee9
Reviews.Content: Location wise very convenient Free Internet Small rooms Tiny bathrooms Everything nearby china town , metro , shopping , food courts Friendly staff Stayed there for one week rooms were very small for 2 people with luggage Old tv No window or day light

Reviews.Title: “horrible... avoid!!!”
Reviews.Author: bizschoolprof
Reviews.Content: Singapore hotels are expensive by Asia standards and i tried to save some money. i choose this hotel because of its price and location. BIG MISTAKE. i got what i paid for and less. the room was windowless, the size of a closet and a tiny moldy shower. the bed was lined with a plastic sheet making for a sweaty sleep. the Authorities should revoke their hotel permit. i learned: spend a little more elsewhere and get a good night's sleep

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Staff”
Reviews.Author: gbsesto
Reviews.Content: We have terrible experience with the most careless and ruse staff we have meet since long time. Given the difficult situation (we cheched 6 hotels in the nearzone, with no room available) we had to accept to check in at 11PM (really!!) and we had to pay same price than usual. The cost is average, but cleanliness is well below, room are really small but this is uual in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “ermm 'liveable' place”
Reviews.Author: chris_626
Reviews.Content: kinda limited space overall. imagine your toilet bowl is just akwardly located very close to the wall. its only a few inches from the wall. furthermore underneath the bed, was filled with dusts and some plastic bags (from the previous occupants!) overall suitable for ppl who couldn't careless bout hygiene and cleanliness. oh ya the tv doesnt hv a remote, it's manually and old skool era hotel. location is superb though.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convinient Location”
Reviews.Author: amphibgoa
Reviews.Content: Hotel 81, China town is one of my favourite budget hotels in Singapore. It is very conveniently located in almost the centre of Singapore and all taxi drivers know it. It is also close to the station China Town. Economically priced, the hotel is easy to book over the net, (generally through agoda.com) and one has a pleasant experience doing so without any hiccups or unpleasant surprises. The check in is straight forward with staff who are quite friendly and straight. It is a multi storied corner building with a lift. The ground floor is numbered 1 as all other buildings in Singapore. The rooms are small and a bit cramped. There is not much place around the bed and it does get a little uncomfortable if one is used to walking around a bed while unpacking or packing. However they are quite well equipped with shower, wash basin, LCD TV, kettle for coffee and tea etc. They are quite clean and well maintained. However, once I did have a leaking wash basin. The rooms are air-conditioned which is a requirement in a hot place like Singapore no matter what time of the year it is. One should always request for an outside room while checking in as they are a bit bigger than the inside ones. The windows are permanently locked so it is not possible to enjoy fresh air. There is a lot of interesting happenings around the hotel. Shopping areas, food streets, china snacks etc are very close to the hotel and easy to find after a little exploration.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad… just overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Nast
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights there in the beginning of April… and it’s not a horrible place, like you may think from some of the previous reviews… It’s just very basic – room is small and most space is taken by the bed, but the bed is clean and was made every day. And yes, the shower room is tiny and everything inside gets wet when you take a shower. It’s just very overpriced for such a basic room, but I guess it’s no surprise in Singapore… so don’t expect too much when you decide to stay there and thus you won’t get disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: h88
Reviews.Content: It's a budget hotel but the rate is not low. There should be better choice if you pay the same rate. Yes the location is good. MRT station is just 1 minute away. There is wide range of choice for dining or shopping. But I really cannot stand the size of the room and there are ants and little flying objects in my room. Soundproof is not done well and you can hear people walking and talking outside. I won't recommend this hotel unless you feel that location is your utmost concern.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: Agnes077
Reviews.Content: you can har all noise from the outside.they dont have proper bedding. the sheets are disgusting old sheets that didnt fit te bed.aircon is dirty and generally this hotel is overpriced for the standard.yak!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: broadshouldersgal
Reviews.Content: I helped my relatives from Malacca to book this hotel, which is only 10 mins walk from my home in Chinatown. The location, food & shopping here is no doubt very good, but the hotel receptionist attitude sucks big time. When I read the past reviews, I felt even more ashamed of my own fellow countrymen. As I arrived at the lobby, I informed the plump, male receptionist that I have a booking for a room of 2. He stared at me, seemed to expect something from me. Then he asked rudely, "Do you have proof that you have made a booking?" I was a little shocked at the way he asked, but as usual, when I travel overseas, I would take out my identity card & credit card (since it's credit card booking) so that receptionists could check the confirmation on their computers. He looked at my ID & CC & said that those are useless & can't prove that I had booked a room. I was like, huh? Then what can prove it? He didn't want to check the computer. He expected a print out confirmation of the room that I booked online. I apologized & said that I don't have it with me, but surely my ID & CC are better proofs than a print out which can be misplaced & land in anyone's hands? He got frustrated & said that without the print out, he could cancel my booking straightaway. Deep down I wanted to cancel it & walk off, but I don't want to kick up a fuss with a receptionist who's unhappy working there, & I didn't want to keep my relatives waiting beside me. So I just apologized again & asked him to check the computer for my confirmation. He reluctantly did. The room is clean, but very tiny & cramped. There's only space for small backpacks, not luggages. There's no remote control for the flat screen tv, so you gotta look at the side of the tv closely to operate it. Air con remote control buttons are damaged for some. It's not worth US$95 at all. I have paid US$60 for many big & clean hotel rooms with breakfast in the US & Australia before. Please stay away from here. If you need free wireless internet access, go to Macdonald's at Chinatown Point just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “BAD SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Hengkyliauw
Reviews.Content: The receptionist was just awful even for a Budget Hotel Standard. I was treated like a refugee. Complaints on room amenities are received with bad attitude although complaints are rectified. Overall in room standard is clean and but cramp and noisy through the night. Overall impression Bad Service, Good Location but Not Worth the Money.

Reviews.Title: “perfect budget product, regretably the price is not budget.”
Reviews.Author: turkbalikadam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine. Tiny room, clean, with A/C and clean toilet. TV. This is a perfect European standard budget hotel with NO restaurant, no breakfast. The only problem is that this should be a £25 a night formula one hotel. Instead its a £57 hotel. So regrettably, this place falls down on price. Sure it is one of the cheapest hotels but for £20 more you can have a real hotel and a 4 star at that, So my advice is go up, or skip Singapore as your stopover destination, fly on a different airline, and get more "bang for your buck". Finally the internet was extortionate at S$30 per day. The location of the hotel was fine though.

Reviews.Title: “this place smells in more ways than one”
Reviews.Author: cushie05
Reviews.Content: You step through the door of the hotel into a smell that is impossible to describe. Our room had one bed with enough room around it to put luggage but then not to walk. There was much climbing over the bed to move. I looked in the bathroom and found a shower alcove with a basin and toilet. My shower alcove at home is the same size but then I have the extra room here to put a basin and toilet that does not get drowned in water. Needless to say we had no windows, but judging by the noise of the traffic that was probably a blessing. The room also had the strange odour to it as the rest of the hotel. This hotel was the most expensive that we stayed in on our trip around Asia. The most expensive and the worst hotel. They probably charged a bigger price because it was the Youth Olympics at the same time as we stayed. It is just across the road from the MRT and across from a nice restaurant. See there is always a silver lining. I would not recomment this hotel to anyone. I also found it almost impossible to sleep on the cement mattress. Hotel 81 China Town - Yuck.

Reviews.Title: “very bad exp.”
Reviews.Author: tom31768
Reviews.Content: afew weeks back my daughter when to singapore for a visit, she stayed at the hotel 81 chinatown with two of her friends. (first mistake)at the point of check-in the hotel staff fail to notify my daughter and her friends, that the room was for two persons only. after that they went shopping and visited the casino.and return quite late. at which point they were told about the two person limit. (second mistake)the staff was asked if the other room could be joining or alest on the same level.they said yes. but only to find out that it was not on the same level.so when they return to ask why the staff reply so go to five star hotel. (third mistake)so my daughter and her friends were angry at this point of beening lied to and check-out this was four in the morning.after they return the room key the chinese female staff said bye bye in a very bad way and the malay male staff call them monkey and pig in malay.so when my daughter return and told me about this i was shocked that singapore service is so bad. i then call the hotel manager name (peter chua) to complain.the manager was very nice on the phone and ask for time to check my story. i call back a week later. to find out what was beening done. as far as i am concern the staff was only given a warning. i would never stay at this hotel and would tell all my friends about this,so stay there if you want to be call a pig or monkey.

Reviews.Title: “tiny rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: acjkt
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a few of the Hotel 81 chain's other properties, so I pretty much know what to expect. The rooms in Hotel 81, Chinatown, were however, especially small, us plus two suitcases meant no room to do anything without climbing over our luggage or bumping into each other. The bathroom was also tiny. The receptionist was monosylabic to the point of grunting, not what I would expect to welcome someone. The only good thing going for this hotel is the location, directly opposite Chinatown LRT station.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for the location”
Reviews.Author: remmahramklov
Reviews.Content: Budget hotel with tiny rooms. Best thing is the location! Don't expect anything else

Reviews.Title: “greedy mean little hotel”
Reviews.Author: hilolo
Reviews.Content: i was planning to be in Singapore for less than 24 hours, waiting for a visa. I booked at Hotel 81 Chinatown online and mentioned that I was arriving early in the morning. Their reception staff is sullen, totally not that interested that you have arrived. Nobody helps you with the door, much less with your luggage. Their 2pm check in policy is strictly enforced, which is fair, so I paid for another night, so I wouldn't have to sit around the sad little lobby from 7:30 am to 2pm. All fine, a this point I just really want a shower and a nap. It turns out that the walk in rate is $11 less than the online rate, go figure. They gave me a room that was 8X7 feet big and had no windows. The bathroom is the kind where you close the door and then the whole bathroom essentially serves as the shower stall. So the floor and toilet seat get wet and stay wet after you shower.They said there was nothing else available, and later they would try to move me. But after spending the previous 36 hours in a plane it was kind of too much to bear. Ok, so at this point, I decide I need a room with windows, so after taking a shower, I go back down and explained, nicely, that I needed to move to another hotel that is closer to the meetings I had that day. I was planning to move to another hotel and could they please refund one of the two nights I had paid for. They said no, in not a nice way, three reception staff ganging up on me, and said that the money back guarantee posted at the front desk applied to a 15 minute grace period (the 15 minute grace period is not indicated on said money back guarantee sign). They refused any kind of a refund and said that I agreed to everything, so I shouldn't complain. I said I realize that this was the policy, but I pointed out that it seemed a bit unreasonable to charge me 2 full nights for staying in their hotel for 3 hours. But they continued to be belligerent and unfriendly. So at this point I decide, I'm leaving anyway, so I went up to get my bags and as I was waiting to settle the bill at the front desk, there were several other people who they were adamantly refusing to issue any kind of refund. So this is likely to be their general MO. There is no restaurant service at the hotel, apparently the nearby coffee places are not open nearby until late in the morning and the internet place nearby does not open until 10:30 am.. In the end it's place run by unpleasant, greedy, mean people, but in the end, I imagine they are just shooting themselves in the foot.

Reviews.Title: “Where do i start?”
Reviews.Author: 11black
Reviews.Content: Would definitely call myself and experienced traveller. I really felt compelled to join today and review this hotel. I would call myself a fairly easy to please sort of person. I'm the sort of person who reads the reviews and the hotel generally surprises me (for the good). Stayed at Hotel 81 Chinatown. There is no denying the location is great. But hey, so is the piece of concrete outside the MRT. I could have easily saved myself $80 + and rolled up a sleeping back there. The concrete would have been just as comfortable as the bed. I have travelled for many years and it is the worst bed I can remember i have slept in. It probably didn't help that my back is the best at the moment, but it was easily the hardest bed i have ever slept on. It had no give it in whatsoever. It reminded me of the times I have fallen asleep on the carpet in front of the tv and the i wake up feeling sore because of the pressure of my body on the floor without any give in it. The amazing thing is, I generally like firmish beds. Anyway, apart from that keeping me awake, I had the noise of the airconditioner to contend with as well. I thought it was the next room having a shower and it would soon stop. Then i realised the noise wasn't going away and i would have to put up with it all night. To make matters worse, it is a small room and the airconditioner is above the bed. After realising noise of the airconditioner I then heard what i thought was fish tank. I though it was somewhere hidden in the room and was going to be an added surprise. The surprise was, the bubbling like the noise of the water in a fish tank was from the aircondtioner as well. BONUS! So, after trying to settle into my bed, trying to block out the aircon noises, i then realised i could here a man snoring in the room next to me. At least it put my mind off the bed. After not being able to sleep, mainly due to the bed (i got used to the other noises), I got fed up (at 2am) and decided to ask reception if i could move to a room with a softer bed. I couldn't believe it when all reception did was laugh. So, at 3.30 am I found myself sitting in a 24 hour internet cafe trying to book another hotel for the following night, even though i had already paid for the extra night. I just couldn't bring myself to pay the $30 sing they were asking for a 1 day internet connection (a joke) at the hotel. I will definately not go back again. The location is great and easy to move around from, the rooms are small, but ok, but what point is there getting a room when you can't get a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Clean room. Small room”
Reviews.Author: Penny1983
Reviews.Content: I've pretty much said it all in the subject line! Paid a bit over $100 for 2 people at Hotel 81 Chinatown. Location's great! Close to MRT Room is clean HOwever the room is small. But you don't stay in your room muhc on a holiday, right?

Reviews.Title: “Just good for the location”
Reviews.Author: mdyC
Reviews.Content: Have the idea of visiting singapore for holiday just few days before the christmas, so hubby and i were looking for hotels. Due to the festive season, the rate were very high. After comparing the price and location, we decided to have one night stay at this hotel. What we felt when we first step in the hotel room was OMG, the room is so small and worst still there is no window. The bathroom is so small too. Luckily we changed to another hotel on the second night. However, the location is good very near to the MRT.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!!”
Reviews.Author: kiwitraveller64
Reviews.Content: Six of us were due to be in Singapore for one night so we booked three rooms here on 8 July. Thankfully it turned out to be for just one night!! As other reviews have stated, the exterior and the lobby are very attractive, but beware of what you're getting for your money! None of our rooms had one window between them. They are extremely small, to such an extent that the double bed just about fits into the room and one has to turn sideways to walk down the side! The air conditioning units are incredibly noisy, but because there are no windows you have to have them on during the night. One of our rooms stunk of alcohol, one stunk of an incredibly strange smell which we still can't decipher. Finally, there are no carpets on the floor of the hotel, just tiles, so you can hear everybody walking past your door at all hours of the night. Basically, don't waste your money here. It's worth spending just that little more to upgrade yourslef to a cardboard box on Smith Street!

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in better Backpacker Hostels”
Reviews.Author: Ulterium
Reviews.Content: What can i say.. we were put on the ground floor of the hotel in a windowless room. I asked to change due to the noise, but they only had another room on the ground floor. The Noise was unbearable with loud banging of other doors (amphasised by wooden floors instead of carpets) and very noisy air con machines that could only be drowned out by wearing my in-ear headphones. The next day i asked to change and they offered me a 4th floor room again without window. it was damp and smelt it too. I change to one on the 2nd floor with a window. One of the most depressing hotels i've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “I just want a clean bed and hot water”
Reviews.Author: AsianGeekette
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel 81 Chinatown from November 8 - 11, 2006. I'm only writing this review now since I needed time to just sit down and write reviews about the hotels I've stayed in for the past few months. I choose this hotel since I wanted a budget hotel around Chinatown (near the office). It seems that every time I'm in Singapore, the office can't book a hotel for me since there's always a convention or a series of conventions happening around Singapore which would make it difficult to reserve a room for me. I decided on Hotel 81 Chinatown since it's right across the Chinatown MRT station. In terms of location, this hotel is convenient. It's walking distance to Smith Street where one can get affordable yummy food. There are bus stations and MRT station nearby. Since it's a budget hotel, there are no frills. Internet is not free. The room is a bit small. The toilet seat gets wet whenever I took a shower since the bathroom is so small. There's no cabinet for clothes - just a place where one can hang clothes. Of course, I had to deal with a lot of curious questions from local people whenever they find out I'm staying here. I have heard about the other reputation of the other branches of Hotel 81. So whenever they ask me how do I find it, I reply "It's difficult to get a hotel room. All I want is a clean bed and hot water. And this hotel provides it."

Reviews.Title: “If you like staying in a windowless cupboard!!!”
Reviews.Author: PeterC48
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty looking hotel from the outside, the reception is also quite nice but the rooms are something of a shock! We had booked a "superior double" for a couple of days and on arrival we were offered a choice of very small rooms with or without a window. When I say very small, I mean just enough room for the bed and a space round it big enough only to walk round. No space to even open a suitcase let alone any wardrobe space to hang clothes. The rooms looked clean enough but they are just too tiny and cell like to be acceptable. We checked out after one night in spite of losing the payment for the second night. If you want somewhere low cost and are prepared for a tiny room then OK, but we were expecting something along the style of an IBIS, a simply furnished basically equipped room with a window and enough room to move. Not too much to ask surely?

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel 81 - Chinatown
HotelInfo.Address: 181 New Bridge Road, Singapore 059418, Singapore
